Package com.ap.kas.controllers

Class AdminController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ap.kas.controllers.AdminController
  • @RestController
@RequestMapping("admin")
public class AdminController
extends java.lang.Object
    The AdminController is a RestController class that contains all methods needed to perform admin-related CRUD operations on the database.

      • readUsers

        @GetMapping("/allUsers")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<MessageResponse> readUsers()
        Returns a list of all existing users, both employees and customers
        Returns:
        ResponseEntity - Contains a 200(OK) with the list of all existing users or a 400(BAD REQUEST)

      • readEmployeeRoles

        @GetMapping("/employeeRoles")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<MessageResponse> readEmployeeRoles()
        Rreturns a list of all possible employee roles
        Returns:
        ResponseEntity - Either returns a 200(OK) with the list of roles or a 400(BAD REQUEST)

      • readCustomerRoles

        @GetMapping("/customerRoles")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<MessageResponse> readCustomerRoles()
        Returns a list of all possible customer roles
        Returns:
        ResponseEntity - Contains a 200(OK) with the list of roles or a 400(BAD REQUEST)

      • createCustomer

        @PostMapping("/newCustomer")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<MessageResponse> createCustomer​(@Valid @ModelAttribute
                                                                               @Valid CustomerCreateDto newCustomer)
        Creates a new customer
        Parameters:
        newCustomer - - The customer to be created
        Returns:
        ResponseEntity - Contains a 200(OK) or 400(BAD REQUEST). Can also contain a 400(BAD REQUEST) when trying to create a customer with an already existing company number.

      • createEmployee

        @PostMapping("/newEmployee")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<MessageResponse> createEmployee​(@Valid @ModelAttribute
                                                                               @Valid EmployeeCreateDto newEmployee)
        Creates a new employee
        Parameters:
        newEmployee - - The employee to be created
        Returns:
        ResponseEntity - Contains a 200(OK) with the created employee object or a 400(BAD REQUEST)

      • deactivateUser

        @PutMapping("/users/{id}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<MessageResponse> deactivateUser​(@PathVariable
                                                                               java.lang.String id)
        Deletes a given user
        Parameters:
        id - - the id of the given user
        Returns:
        ResponseEntity - Contains a 200(OK) or a 400(BAD REQUEST)
